page.title: 10The Village of Austerfield
page.content: Austerfield is a small village lying alongside the busy A614.The dwellings are of a variety of types and ages. Some new houses and bungalows have been built at the South end of the village while the Norman church and older houses occupy more central positions.Several of the latter lie directly alongside the road.Also in the centre is a large fire_brick works which results in sticky black dust and a faint smell of carbon overlaying the area.The only shop is the Post Office. The population is an ageing one.Of the 450 inhabitants only about half a dozen are school aged children and there is a high proportion of retired people.Although the area is a rural one the number of working farms has declined from 9 at the beginning of the century to one.The remaining land has become part of larger concerns.
